update.description:
Two new plugins:

* HydraPlugin: Publish messages on the topic ~hydra with the state of the controller.
* HydraPluginDemo: Model plugin that uses HydraPlugin to move a model using the right joystick.

Here is a new [Hydra tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=hydra).

For testing follow the tutorial, and then:


```
#!c++

gazebo ../worlds/hydra_demo.world
```
update.title: Razer Hydra support

content.raw: should be safe to remove this

The Poll function returns a bool. Should we listen to that bool?

See `hydra_integration_nate` for an example.
content.html:
The Poll function returns a bool. Should we listen to that bool?

See hydra_integration_nate for an example.

content.raw: I've verified that the world loads fine without hydra support. Appropriate error messages are produced in the log file.
content.html: I've verified that the world loads fine without hydra support. Appropriate error messages are produced in the log file.

content.raw: I think it's okay to install this world file if libusb is not installed. The plugin should fail gracefully.
content.html: I think it's okay to install this world file if libusb is not installed. The plugin should fail gracefully.

content.raw:
This should be true, and error didn't happen.

Then you can get rid of the `return true;` on line 368.
content.html:
This should be true, and error didn't happen.

Then you can get rid of the return true; on line 368.

content.raw: Same as above, with different string for gzerr.
content.html: Same as above, with different string for gzerr.

content.raw:
Could you switch this to use gzerr? I think this will work:

`gzerr << "Hydra ioctl error HIDIOCGRAWNAME: " << strerror(errno);`
content.html:
Could you switch this to use gzerr? I think this will work:

gzerr << "Hydra ioctl error HIDIOCGRAWNAME: " << strerror(errno);

content.raw: Curly brackets around while loop contents.
